definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: Such as sword stood in his way.
sentences.chinese: 蘭如劍擋住了他的去路。

sentences.english: Two come out onto the trail ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 有兩隻在他的前面堵住去路。

sentences.english: I got  frustrated by other people slowing me down by stopping to chat in the street.
sentences.chinese: 我對有人站在路上聊天而擋住了去路的事情很惱火。

sentences.english: Without wind and rain resistance, must be the door to a blessing.
sentences.chinese: 若無風雨阻去路，必定上門來祝福。

sentences.english: When the stone man moved aft, Duck blocked his way, pole in hand.
sentences.chinese: 當石人想船尾逃去時，鴨子用篙封住了他的去路。

sentences.english: The reality is they have nowhere else to go.
sentences.chinese: 事實是中國人沒有其他去路了。

sentences.english: Stretching over a wide expanse of land, the mountains blocked yugong's way making it inconvenient for him and his family to get around.
sentences.chinese: 二山佔地廣闊，擋住去路，使他和家人往來極爲不便。

sentences.english: Count Dooku stood in their path.
sentences.chinese: 杜庫伯爵擋住了他們的去路。

sentences.english: the others, who saw no way out, surrendered.
sentences.chinese: 其會水者料無去路，亦皆投降。

sentences.english: Tonglingqiao When walking across the Yingxian Bridge, there is a huge rock lying amidst the road.
sentences.chinese: 通靈竅走過迎仙橋，只見一堵巨崖擋住去路。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold suddenly from the mountains there stopped out of the way.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金忽然從山中竄出來攔住了去路。

sentences.english: Fled to a lane that has, and, behold, it has two people blocking the way.
sentences.chinese: 逃到一處巷口，不料卻有兩人擋住去路。

definition: to get out of the way/to step aside
to get out of the way
to come close/to get near to/front
to block sb's path/to obstruct/to flag down (a taxi)
to open up a path/to make one's way through/to construct a road/(electricity) open circuit
